meanings.definition: A nickname or additional name given to a person.
meanings.sent1: My friend's agnomina is 'Smiley' because she always has a big grin.
meanings.sent2: Everyone calls him 'Speedy', which is his agnomina because he runs so fast.
meanings.sent3: I wonder what my agnomina would be if I were a character in a book.
meanings.sent4: Her agnomina 'Sunshine' perfectly reflects her cheerful personality.
meanings.sent5: In our group, 'Brainiac' is the agnomina for the smartest member.

meanings.definition: A descriptive or qualifying name added to a person's original name.
meanings.sent1: The agnomina 'the Great' was added to Alexander to honor his achievements.
meanings.sent2: When she became a knight, 'Sir' was added as her agnomina.
meanings.sent3: I find it amusing how historical figures often have interesting agnomina.
meanings.sent4: The agnomina 'the Brave' can inspire courage in others.
meanings.sent5: Adding 'the Magnificent' as an agnomina can make a name sound grand.
